content.question: A student writes down the reaction shown for tritium (hydrogen-<math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>) decaying into helium-<math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>. Another student claims that the reaction is written incorrectly. Which of the following supports the claim that the written reaction is incorrect?

choices.label: Changing the number of protons within a nucleus violates conservation of charge.
Changing the number of neutrons within a nucleus violates conservation of nucleon number.
Creating a neutrino without also creating an antineutrino violates conservation of neutrino number.
Creating an electron and a neutrino without also creating antiparticles violates conservation of lepton number.

content.answer: Creating an electron and a neutrino without also creating antiparticles violates conservation of lepton number.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
